editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

The infection has begun and it’s up to you to strategically spread and evolve a deadly plague to bring about the end of the human race. Saving the world and being a hero is honourable, but decimating the world with a deadly infection is a whole lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: This turn-based RPG recalls the secret-filled dungeons of old-school classics – and adds contemporary tweaks like awesome lighting effects and a streamlined interface.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing underground lines come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: There's more than monsters to fear here.

editorialNotes.standard: Being able to write computer code is a supremely useful talent, but learning the basics can be a tough, tedious slog. Human Resource Machine wraps computer logic fundamentals inside a wonderful, whimsical puzzle game, full of cartoon conveyer belts and demanding managers. It’s so much fun you might not realise how much knowledge you’re soaking up.
Form smart alliances to keep the spice flowing in this superb digital re-imagining of the popular board game.

ios.subtitle: A tale of five tree creatures

editorialNotes.standard: When young astronaut Kosmo sees his robot girlfriend, Nova, blown to pieces before his eyes, he gallantly sets off across the galaxy to find his beloved’s parts and put her back together. This beautiful and whimsical point-and-click adventure will steal your heart as you visit dozens of kooky planets and encounter everything from alien arcades to robot discos. Each unique world introduces adorable critters, fantastic sights, clever puzzles to solve and tokens of affection to discover. Star-crossed romance has never felt so rewarding.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must play—or replay—LucasArts’ classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labour of love.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged society – and unravel supernatural mysteries – in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernised battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.
Dish out egusi, puff puff and other classic Nigerian dishes in this savoury tie-in with the animated series.
We love dropping into this city builder’s immersive third-person view, which lets us stroll through bustling neighbourhoods of our own creation.

ios.subtitle: A story about love and life
The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

If you’re going to wage Total War, you better have a total strategy. Feral’s faithful port takes us right back to the amazingly complex battles of Rome. We can’t help but make alliances, purposely break them, then chase down our newfound enemies. It’s all fun and games, right? That is, until they get the upper hand…

editorialNotes.short: Plan your attack with robots and ricochets.

editorialNotes.tagline: This party game is the bomb!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Smartly positioning fighters in this roguelike deckbuilder helps the gameplay shine as brightly as the flame you’re tasked with defending.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Be the best zombie you can

name: A Little to the Left: Stars
